alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 5:58PM CDT until April 13 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Hernando, Lewisburg, Eudora, Bright, Alphaba, Cedarview, Cockrum, Nesbit, Love, Fairhaven, Robinson Gin, Miller, Frees Corners, Handy Corner and Trinity. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
